name: Pipelines inside Repositories
description: GitLab uses this method of configuring pipelines, and it aligns code and build pipeline.

name: Agile
description: Up until now, the best way to handle changing requirements in an already started project.

name: Team Conventions
description: The conventions help to get every member of the team in the same page.

name: Domain Driven Design (DDD)
description: Approach complex problems via Bounded Contexts and Ubiquitous Language.

name: Fluent APIs
description: Prefer explicit methods to static or attributed solutions i.e. FluentAssertions, FluentEFCore,

name: Code Review
description: Try to use at all times. It could be skipped for specific areas like scripts.

name: Documentation in Version Control
description: "Avoid placing documentation in Sharepoint
column8: etc. Place documentation as close to the code as possible and remove when no longer relevant."

name: Sprint Retrospective
description: "The only way to get improvement in an heterogeneous team."

name: Architecture Documentation in arc42
description: "It has its uses
column6: but it requires too much effort for any non-greater-than-life project."

name: E-Mail as communication mechanism
description: Avoid using E-Mails for communication since the probability of somebody being left out increase with team size.

name: Daily Standups
description: "Adapt the frequency of standups to the project. As a rule of thumb
column6: have X standups per week where X is the team size."

name: Conda Environments
description: Start all projects with a powered-up virtual environment.

name: Anaconda
description: Conda environments and integration with vscode make this the perfect Python3 platform.

name: Azure DevOps
description: Some of the best and easiest query capabilities for Agile Boards.

name: Gitlab
description: Perfect platform for self-hosted repositories/projects. Avoid it for Agile/Scrum

name: GitHub Pages
description: Easy to use and (for my purposes) free. Evaluate against Zeit now and Netlify.

name: Netlify
description: Easy to use and (for my purposes) free. Evaluate against Zeit now and GitHub pages.

name: Zeit Now
description: Easy to use and (for my purposes) free. Evaluate against Netlify and GitHub pages.

name: ESLint and TSLint
description: Adopt the same conventions for the whole team.

name: Visual Studio Code
description: Adopt the same conventions for the whole team.

name: Visual Studio 2019 Community
description: Avoid depending on Enterprise version of this IDE.

name: PlantUML
description: Even thougth UML-as-code is great for version-controlled environments, its usability is limited for big diagrams.

name: IntelliJ Idea
description: Better IDE than Eclipse for java.

name: Microsoft Teams Group
description: Team communication should be kept to a minimum in writen channels. Use for documentation purposes, other processes (retrospectives, polls,..) or asynchronous discussions sparingly.

name: Dependabot
description: Dependency checks for free.

name: Slack
description: Team communication should be kept to a minimum in writen channels. Use for documentation purposes or asynchronous discussions sparingly.

name: Eclipse
description: Intellij Idea offers a much better IDE for java. For eveything else, use VSCode instead.

name: Balsamiq
description: Far form optimal from a version-control perspective.

name: TiddlyWiki
description: It does not play well with Version Control and most people do not understand the syntax.

name: Dotnet Core
description: This seems to be the best platform to develop server code atm.

name: C#8.0
description: Use version 8.0 everywhere possible. The benefits coming from Nullable Reference Types are too good to ignore.

name: Python3
description: Python 3 is the supported

name: Reactive Extensions (Rx)
description: Use instead of promises or async-await when dealing with any kind of logic more complex than simple request-response.

name: Dapper
description: Use micro-ORM like Dapper only for Queries, avoid its usage for complex Command scenarios

name: F#
description: Even though the syntax is elegant, most teams are still not prepared for a functional-first approach.

name: GraphQL
description: Contrary to all the fuss, GraphQL still seems to be not-quite-there when it comes to .NET.

name: Hot Chocolate
description: Contrary to all the fuss, GraphQL still seems to be not-quite-there when it comes to .NET.

name: Python2
description: Avoid using this version of the language, strive for a more supported and documented Python3.

name: R
description: Difficult syntax and less integrations with respect to Python3 means it should be avoided.
